DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Repeat Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is intended to occur at some point in the context of a particular study that represents a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether they may not participate in a study. NOTE(S): This allows questions defined as agnostic criteria in defined eligibility criterion (that is, they could be used either as inclusion or exclusion criteria) to be referenced in specific study protocols and allows the inclusion/exclusion distinction to be determined for that study specifically. The period of time over which the planned activity is repeated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Repeat Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
